page.title: 10A DAY IN THE LIFE OF LOUISA
page.content: I am 11 years old and each Saturday morning at 8.o'clock, I get up, have my breakfast, wash and put on my riding clothes. Then my family and I jump in the car, drive off to Elvaston Riding Centre and I have my 10.0'clock ride. When my lesson is over we call in at Auntie Sheila's. Last Saturday we stayed for dinner and tea. Then we went home. I really like riding and horses, that's why I am telling you about it. When we arrive home I change my clothes. Then it's back in the car and off to Gran's, who lives 5 minutes away from us. When we arrive at Gran's I go and call for Julie, who stay's at her Gran's for the weekend. We play until 8.o'clock. Then she goes in. Next my Gran and I have chips from the chippy van. Afterwards we get into bed.
